Use tuple structs for typedefs

labels.name: discussion :speech_balloon:
labels.description: The design isn't finalized yet, feel free to participate in the discussion.

candidates.body:
This is mostly an experiment, so sandbox compilation is currently broken. Generally I like the idea, but it still has some rough edges. For example, `std::iter::Step` is still unstable, so round-loops look a little ugly. There is still room for additional improvements. 

Closes #79 and #203.

candidates.title: Update dependencies without breaking changes
candidates.body:
* Trying to update `mio` introduce breaking changes due using `tokio` project - still on `0.5` version
* `params` crate still rely on `body-parser 0.5.0` and `serde-*-0.8.x` family due more than half year not released `iron`

In general, it's good practice keep dependencies up to date :)

Remove benches/ testnet/ implement profiler as ctrl-c handler
candidates.body:
Updated `flamer`
Removed testnet,benches folders.
Implemented ctrl-c handler for profiler.

All code for benches moved into `validator_generator` repo.

Results:
In archive file two files:
file11 -> node1 receive transaction from generator
file21 -> node2 with empty pool, and get transactions "on demand" from node1.

[PROFILING.zip](https://github.com/exonum/exonum-core/files/1126891/PROFILING.zip)

candidates.title: Clap factory implementation v2
candidates.body:
For now I created `NodeBuilder` object which incapsulate all work with `cmd` and running node.
This is probably "basic" of future `ExonumApplication`

Additionally I implement `ServiceFactory` helper, which used to create service, which given config (without end-user code).
This trait probably should be moved into `blockchain` module, and take some methods from `Service`

In "end-user" code its look like 
```
     let node = NodeBuilder::new().with_service(TimeStampingServiceFactory);
    node.run()
```

We should make pr in 

- [x]  cryptocurrency https://github.com/exonum/cryptocurrency/pull/75
- [x]  exonum-configuration https://github.com/exonum/exonum-configuration/pull/43
- [X]  exonum-btc-anchoring https://github.com/exonum/exonum-btc-anchoring/pull/68

candidates.title: Add cargo audit in travis ci
Rename `NodeState` to `ServiceContext` and remove unnecessary methods.
Apply breaking changes of storage refactoring
candidates.body:
This PR apply future changes to the key representation for `ListTable` and `MerkleTable`.

**Breaking Changes** in code:

- `MerkleTable<T, K, V>` converted to `MerkleTable<T, V>`
- `ListTable<T, K, V>` converted to `ListTable<T, V>`
- All keys are always `u64`

**Rationale:**

- I do not think that we should be given the opportunity to choose the size of the key for the lists and not cause the situation "640 kb are enough for everything"
- The code is much simpler and `num` dependency are removed
- For Merkle table, the number of intermediate allocations is reduced (technically not relevant for this PR, but will work in the future PR with `StorageKey` trait)

**How this work:**

For `ListTable` just always use 8 bytes for keys, the layout is the same. For `MerkleTable`, key serialization is a little tricky. The key size is surprisingly 8 bytes too and for every node is defined as: 

```
(height << 58) + index
```

The idea is to use first 6 bits of a key for height and least 58 bits for an index. This means that **the size of the Merkle tree is limited by 2^58 elements**. The maximum height of a tree is 59 and it fits in 6 bits. The lexicographic order of the nodes is the same.

Currently, this code looks scary because of the removal of `num` dependency (e.g. `...(1 * 1) + 1`). The reason I do not want to improve this is I've completely rewritten these implementations in a separate branch.

candidates.title: Combine public/private API endpoints from services
candidates.body:
Closes #66. 

**Breaking Changes!**

 - Adds `service_name` getter to `Service` trait. Services must implement this function.
 - `Node::run` now starts the api threads according to `NodeApiConfiguration` 
 - Endpoints for explorer api now have a prefix `/api/explorer/v1/` instead of `/api/v1/blockchain_explorer`. 
 - Endpoint for services now have a prefix `/api/services/{service_name}`. 

Just implement `private_api_handler` and `public_api_handler` for `Service` trait and use `Node::run` for launching application. Public and private apis will be launch automaticaly.

Implementation [example](https://github.com/exonum/exonum-configuration/pull/22):
